main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Fairbanks, Alaska in July 1956. The object, described as oval in size and silver or metallic in color, appeared to be stationary before disappearing at high speed in an upward direction within a 30-minute observation period.
interesting points: The object was initially observed to be oval in size, similar to a basketball, and had no discernible features or details.
No sound, trail, or exhaust was noted, and the object appeared to flicker or pulsate, drawing the observers' attention with its brightness.
The sighting was made during daylight, with the observers located at CLCE 2259.
Weather conditions at the time of the observation were fairly clear with good visibility, and no thunderstorms were reported in the area.

A WEA BLN (weather balloon) was released from a log site of Ladd AFB, which was miles away at the time of the sighting, leading to speculation about the object being associated with the weather balloon or the star progeon, although no physical evidence was presented.
sighted object: one oval-shaped, silver or metallic colored UFO
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
